title: Mutually Exclusive
text: It is important to note that since P(I and F) $$=$$ $$0$$, then this means that I and F are mutually exclusive. This is by the definition of being mutually exclusive itself.

title: Mutually Exclusive Rules
text: If two events are mutually exclusive, lets say I and F, then it follows that P(I or F) $$=$$ P(I) + P(F).

title: Answer
text: Since I and F are mutually exclusive, our answer is going to be P(I) + P(F). What is this sum?
